`VisitResponse` objects.\",\"/sales-sync-backend/simple_app.py\":\"This file is a Flask application that provides a RESTful API for managing brands, categories, and products. It uses SQLAlchemy to interact with a SQLite database.\\n\\n`Brand`: A model representing a brand, with a name and description, and a one-to-many relationship with categories.\\n\\n`Category`: A model representing a category, with a name and description, and a many-to-one relationship with a brand and a one-to-many relationship with products.\\n\\n`Product`: A model representing a product, with a name and description, and a many-to-one relationship with a brand and a category.\\n\\n`get_brands()`: Retrieves a list of all brands.\\n\\n`get_brand(brand_id)`: Retrieves a specific brand, including its categories and products.\\n\\n`create_brand()`: Creates a new brand, with optional categories and products.\\n\\n`get_brand_categories(brand_id)`: Retrieves a list of all categories for a specific brand.\\n\\n`create_category(brand_id)`: Creates a new category for a specific brand, with optional products.\\n\\n`get_category_products(category_id)`: Retrieves a list of all products for a specific category.\\n\\n`create_product(category_id)`: Creates a new product for a specific category.\\n\\n`get_brand_products(brand_id)`: Retrieves a list of all products for a specific brand.\\n\\n`create_brand_product(brand_id)`: Creates a new product for a specific brand, with an optional category.\",\"/sales-sync-backend/fix_passwords.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it performs the following tasks:\\n\\n1. Generates proper password hashes for an admin, manager, and agent using the `bcrypt` library.\\n2. Prints the generated hashes to the console.\\n3. Updates the password hashes in a SQLite database for the corresponding user accounts (identified by their phone numbers).\\n4. Commits the changes to the database and closes the connection.\\n5. images.\",\"/salespace-scan/src/components/ui/tooltip.tsx\":\"This file is a React component that provides a tooltip functionality using the Radix UI library. It exports several components and a provider that can be used to create and customize tooltips in a React application.\\n\\n`TooltipProvider`: A provider component that wraps the tooltip components and manages the state of the tooltip.\\n\\n`Tooltip`: The root component that wraps the entire tooltip functionality.\\n\\n`TooltipTrigger`: A component that triggers the display of the tooltip when interacted with.\\n\\n`TooltipContent`: A component that renders the content of the tooltip, with customizable styles and animations.\",\"/salespace-scan/src/components/ShopsMap.tsx\":\"This file is a React component that displays a map of shop locations in South Africa using the Leaflet library. It includes the following classes and functions:\\n\\n`ShopsMap`: A React functional component that renders a map with markers for each shop location, along with a loading state and a fallback message if no shops are available.\\n\\n`useEffect`: A React hook that adds a global CSS style to fix z-index issues between the Leaflet map and any dialogs or modals that may be displayed on the page.\\n\\nOverall, this file provides a reusable map component that can be used to display the locations of shops or other points of interest on a map, with customizable styling and behavior.\",\"/Daily_salessync/Scripts/enhanced_ai_summarizer.py\":\"This file contains an `EnhancedAISummarizer` class and several functions that are used to generate executive summaries and answer questions using a Llama 3 language model. The file also includes a main block that tests the `EnhancedAISummarizer` class with sample data.\\n\\n`EnhancedAISummarizer`: A class that initializes and loads an optimized Llama 3 model, and provides methods to generate executive summaries and answer questions based on the provided data.\\n\\n`_load_model`: A function that loads the Llama 3 model with quantization for memory efficiency, and creates a text generation pipeline.\\n\\n`_load_fallback_model`: A function that loads a smaller fallback model if the main Llama 3 model fails to load.\\n\\n`create_executive_summary`: A function that generates an executive summary from processed report data using the Llama 3 model.\\n\\n`_create_llama_prompt`: A function that creates a structured prompt optimized for the Llama 3 model.\\n\\n`answer_question`: A function that answers user questions using the Llama 3 model with enhanced context understanding.\\n\\n`_create_question_prompt`: A function that creates a prompt for answering specific questions.\\n\\n`_create_fallback_summary`: A function that creates a basic summary if the Llama 3 generation fails.\\n\\n`_create_basic_answer`: A function that creates a basic answer without AI generation.\",\"/salespace-scan/src/components/ui/card.tsx\":\"This file defines a set of React components that can be used to create a card-like UI element. Here\\u0027s a summary of each component:\\n\\n`Card`: A container component that provides a basic card-like layout with rounded corners, a border, and a drop shadow.\\n\\n`CardHeader`: A component that represents the header section of a card, typically containing a title and a description.\\n\\n`CardTitle`: A component that represents the title of a card.\\n\\n`CardDescription`: A component that represents the description of a card.\\n\\n`CardContent`: A component that represents the main content area of a card.\\n\\n`CardFooter`: A component that represents the footer section of a card.\\n\\nThe file exports all of these components, allowing them to be used in other parts of a React application.\",\"/salespace-scan/src/pages/StartVisit.tsx\":\"This file contains a React component called `StartVisit` that allows users to start a new visit, either as an individual or a customer. The component fetches and displays a list of existing shops, allows the user to search for shops, and provides options to create a new shop if the desired one is not found. The component also allows the user to select a brand, category, and product for the visit.\\n\\n`StartVisit`: A React component that handles the logic for starting a new visit, including selecting a shop, brand, category, and product.\\n\\n`handleSelectShop`: A function that handles the selection of a shop for a customer visit, ensuring that all required information (location, brand, category, and product) is provided.\\n\\n`handleCreateNewShop`: A function that handles the creation of a new shop, navigating the user to the appropriate form based on the visit type.\",\"/salespace-scan/src/lib/utils.ts\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It exports a single function:\\n\\n`cn`: A utility function that merges multiple class values using the `clsx` and `tailwind-merge` libraries, providing a concise way to conditionally apply CSS classes.\",\"/salespace-scan/src/components/ui/date-range-picker.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`DatePickerWithRange`: A React component that provides a date range picker with a calendar UI, allowing users to select a date range.\\n\\nThe file also imports several other components and utilities from various sources, including `React`, `date-fns`, `lucide-react`, `react-day-picker`, `@/lib/utils`, `@/components/ui/button`, `@/components/ui/calendar`, and `@/components/ui/popover`. These imported components and utilities are used to build the `DatePickerWithRange` component.\",\"/Daily_salessync/FIX_SUMMARY.md\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it provides a detailed fix summary for the `team_lead_visits_report.py` script, which was failing due to a missing input file. The summary covers the problem, root cause, and the solution implemented, including the following key changes:\\n\\n1. Enhanced file detection to automatically find the most recent daily visits file.\\n2. Added auto-generation capability to generate the daily visits report if needed.\\n3. Improved error messages with clear instructions on how to fix the issue.\\n4. Implemented smart output naming to maintain date consistency between input and output files.\\n\\nThe file also includes information on how the script works now, the testing results, usage examples, and the integration with the daily email reports system.\",\"/Daily_salessync/Scripts/install_daily_reports.py\":\"This file is an installation script for setting up automated daily email reports. It provides three options for setting up the reports: cron job, systemd timer, and manual testing. The script checks for required dependencies, verifies the environment configuration, and sets up the chosen method for running the daily reports. It also includes functions to test the reports generation and email sending.\\n\\n`check_requirements`: Checks if all required Python packages are installed.\\n\\n`check_env_config`: Checks if the `.env` file is properly configured with the necessary environment variables.\\n\\n`setup_cron`: Sets up a cron job to run the daily reports.\\n\\n`setup_systemd`: Sets up a systemd timer to run the daily reports.\\n\\n`test_reports`: Tests the reports generation and email sending.\\n\\n`main`: The main function that handles the installation process based on the chosen method.\",\"/Daily_salessync/Scripts/launch_ai_assistant.py\":\"This file is a Python script that serves as a launcher for the SalesSync AI Assistant, which is an AI-powered database Q\\u0026A system. It does not contain any classes, but it has the following functions:\\n\\n`check_dependencies()`: Checks if the required dependencies (MySQL connector, Pandas, Transformers, and Torch) are installed, and installs them if they are missing.\\n\\n`main()`: The main function that starts the SalesSync AI Assistant, checks the dependencies, and runs the interactive session of the DatabaseQASystem.\\n\\nIn summary, this script is responsible for launching the SalesSync AI Assistant, ensuring that the required dependencies are installed, and providing an interactive session for the user to interact with the AI-powered database Q\\u0026A system.\",\"/Daily_salessync/Scripts/web_interface/app.py\":\"This file is a Flask backend for a web-based chatbot interface. It does not contain any classes, but it has the following functions:\\n\\n`initialize_qa_system()`: Initializes the Q\\u0026A system for the chatbot.\\n\\n`index()`: Renders the main page of the web interface.\\n\\n`chat()`: Handles incoming chat messages, processes them using the Q\\u0026A system, and returns the response.\\n\\n`status()`: Checks the status of the AI system and returns the status.\\n\\n`examples()`: Returns a list of example questions (this function has been removed for the professional interface).\\n\\nThe file also sets up the Flask application and runs the web server.\",\"/salespace-scan/src/components/ui/visit-response-view.tsx\":\"This file contains a React component called `VisitResponseView` that renders a nested object structure with formatted keys and values. It also includes several helper functions to format the data for display.\\n\\n`formatKey`: Formats a string by capitalizing the first letter of each word.\\n`formatValue`: Formats a value based on its type, handling images, arrays, and nested objects.\\n`NestedObject`: Recursively renders a nested object structure.\\n`VisitResponseView`: The main component that renders the visit response data.\\n\\nThe file provides a reusable component for displaying complex data structures in a user-friendly way, with support for various data types including images.\",\"/salespace-scan/package-lock.json\":\"Error generating summary after max retries\",\"/salespace-scan/components.json\":\"This file appears to be a configuration file for a project using the Shadcn UI library. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the project\\u0027s structure and settings. Here\\u0027s a summary of the file\\u0027s contents:\\n\\n`$schema`: Specifies the schema for the Shadcn UI configuration.\\n`style`: Sets the default style for the project.\\n`rsc`: Indicates whether the project is using React Server Components.\\n`tsx`: Specifies that the project is using TypeScript.\\n`tailwind`: Configures the Tailwind CSS settings, including the location of the configuration file, the CSS file, the base color, the use of CSS variables, and the prefix.\\n`aliases`: Defines a set of aliases for various directories in the project, such as components, utilities, UI components, libraries, and hooks.\\n\\nThis file is used to set up the project\\u0027s structure and configuration, making it easier to manage and maintain the codebase.\",\"/sales-sync-backend/run_migration.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it sets up a Flask application, creates the database tables, and runs a migration script.\\n\\nThe file performs the following tasks:\\n\\n1. Imports necessary modules and functions from the `app` and `migrations` modules.\\n2. Overrides the database URI to use SQLite for testing purposes.\\n3. Creates the Flask application using the `create_app()` function.\\n4. In the `if __name__ \\u003d\\u003d \\\"__main__\\\":` block, it performs the following actions:\\n - Creates all the database tables if they don\\u0027t already exist using `db.create_all()`.\\n - Runs the `run_migration()` function from the `add_base64_image_columns` module to execute a database migration.\",\"/salespace-scan/package.json\":\"Error generating summary after max retries\",\"/Daily_salessync/Scripts/team_lead_visits_report.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`find_latest_daily_visits_file`: Finds the most recent daily visits CSV file.\\n\\n`generate_daily_visits_if_needed`: Generates a new daily visits report if one doesn\\u0027t exist.\\n\\n`read_daily_visits_pivot`: Reads the existing per-user daily visits pivot CSV.\\n\\n`compute_team_lead_sums`: Aggregates per-user counts to per-team-lead sums per date.\\n\\n`write_team_lead_csv`: Writes the team lead daily visits data to a CSV file.\\n\\n`write_team_lead_xlsx`: Writes the team lead daily visits data to an Excel file.\\n\\n`main`: The main function that determines the input and output files and generates the team lead daily visits report.\\n\\nThe file also defines a dictionary `TEAM_LEAD_TO_USERS` that maps team leads to their direct reports, and a list `LEAD_ORDER` that specifies the desired output column order.\",\"/salespace-scan/src/pages/ProductManagement.tsx\":\"This file is a React component called `ProductManagement` that provides a user interface for managing products for a brand. It includes the following classes and functions:\\n\\n`ProductManagement`: A React component that handles the management of products for a brand, including creating, updating, and deleting products, as well as filtering and searching products.\\n\\n`loadBrandAndProducts`: A function that loads the brand, categories, and products for the selected brand.\\n\\n`filterProductsByCategory`: A function that filters the products based on the selected category.\\n\\n`handleCreateProduct`: A function that handles the creation of a new product.\\n\\n`handleUpdateProduct`: A function that handles the update of an existing product.\\n\\n`handleDeleteProduct`: A function that handles the deletion of a product.\\n\\n`handleImageChange`: A function that handles the change of the product image.\\n\\n`openEditDialog`: A function that opens the edit product dialog.\\n\\n`openDeleteDialog`: A function that opens the delete product confirmation dialog.\\n\\n`resetForm`: A function that resets the form fields.\",\"/salespace-scan/backend/models.py\":\"This file defines the database models for a retail management application using SQLAlchemy. Here\\u0027s a summary of the classes and functions:\\n\\n`User`: Represents a user of the application, with attributes such as phone, password, role, and relationships to other entities.\\n\\n`set_password()`: Sets the password hash for the user.\\n\\n`check_password()`: Checks if the provided password matches the stored password hash.\\n\\n`Shop`: Represents a retail shop, with attributes such as name, address, and contact information.\\n\\n`Visit`: Represents a visit made by an agent to a shop, with attributes such as timestamp, notes, and status.\\n\\n`Goal`: Represents a business goal, with attributes such as title, description, target value, and dates.\\n\\n`progress`: Calculates the progress of a goal based on the current and target values.\\n\\n`status`: Determines the status of a goal based on its progress and end date.\\n\\n`Brand`: Represents a brand, with attributes such as name, description, and logo.\\n\\n`Category`: Represents a product category, with attributes such as name and description, and a relationship to a brand.\\n\\n`Product`: Represents a product, with attributes such as name, description, price, and SKU, and relationships to a brand and category.\",\"/salespace-scan/src/components/ui/dropdown-menu.tsx\":\"This file defines a set of React components for creating a dropdown menu using the Radix UI library. Here are the class and function names along with their summaries:\\n\\n`DropdownMenu`: The root component for the dropdown menu.\\n\\n`DropdownMenuTrigger`: The component that triggers the dropdown menu.\\n\\n`DropdownMenuGroup`: A component that groups related dropdown menu items.\\n\\n`DropdownMenuPortal`: A component that renders the dropdown menu content in a portal.\\n\\n`DropdownMenuSub`: A component that represents a sub-menu within the dropdown menu.\\n\\n`DropdownMenuRadioGroup`: A component that manages radio button-style dropdown menu items.\\n\\n`DropdownMenuSubTrigger`: A component that triggers a sub-menu within the dropdown menu.\\n\\n`DropdownMenuSubContent`: The content of a sub-menu within the dropdown menu.\\n\\n`DropdownMenuContent`: The content of the dropdown menu.\\n\\n`DropdownMenuItem`: A single item within the dropdown menu.\\n\\n`DropdownMenuCheckboxItem`: A checkbox-style dropdown menu item.\\n\\n`DropdownMenuRadioItem`: A radio button-style dropdown menu item.\\n\\n`DropdownMenuLabel`: A label for a group of dropdown menu items.\\n\\n`DropdownMenuSeparator`: A separator between dropdown menu items.\\n\\n`DropdownMenuShortcut`: A component that displays a shortcut for a dropdown menu item.\",\"/salespace-scan/src/pages/DailyReports.tsx\":\"This file is a React component that displays a daily report page for an admin user. It fetches and displays various statistics related to agent and shop performance, and allows the user to filter the data by date and selected agents/managers. The component also provides the ability to download the report data in an Excel format.\\n\\n`DailyReports`: A React component that renders the daily reports page for an admin user.\\n\\n`handleAgentToggle`: A function that toggles the selection of an agent in the report filters.\\n\\n`handleManagerToggle`: A function that toggles the selection of a manager in the report filters, and updates the selected agents accordingly.\\n\\n`handleSelectAllAgents`: A function that selects or deselects all agents in the report filters.\\n\\n`handleDownloadExcel`: A function that downloads the daily report data in an Excel format.\\n\\n`getAgentName`: A function that retrieves the name of an agent based on the provided agent ID.\",\"/salespace-scan/src/components/ui/drawer.tsx\":\"This file defines a set of React components that create a drawer UI element. Here are the class and function names along with their summaries:\\n\\n`Drawer`: A wrapper component around the `DrawerPrimitive.Root` component that adds additional functionality.\\n\\n`DrawerTrigger`: A component that triggers the opening of the drawer.\\n\\n`DrawerPortal`: A component that renders the drawer content in a portal.\\n\\n`DrawerClose`: A component that closes the drawer.\\n\\n`DrawerOverlay`: A component that renders a semi-transparent overlay behind the drawer.\\n\\n`DrawerContent`: A component that renders the content of the drawer.\\n\\n`DrawerHeader`: A component that renders the header section of the drawer.\\n\\n`DrawerFooter`: A component that renders the footer section of the drawer.\\n\\n`DrawerTitle`: A component that renders the title of the drawer.\\n\\n`DrawerDescription`: A component that renders the description of the drawer.\",\"/salespace-scan/src/pages/VisitLog.tsx\":\"This file is a React component that displays a visit log for agents. It fetches and displays visit data, including statistics and a list of visits with details. The component also allows agents to start a new visit.\\n\\n`VisitLog`: A React component that displays a visit log for agents, including visit statistics and a list of visits with details.\\n\\n`formatVisitData`: A function that formats the visit data for display in the `VisitDetails` component.\\n\\n`handleStartVisit`: A function that navigates to the \\u0027start-visit\\u0027 page when the user clicks the \\u0027New Visit\\u0027 button.\",\"/Daily_salessync/Scripts/launch_enhanced_universal_ai.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`launch_enhanced_universal_ai()`: This function launches the Enhanced Universal SalesSync AI Assistant, which can answer any question and generate executive summaries using Tiny AI.\\n\\nThe file is a Python script that launches an Enhanced Universal AI Assistant, which can answer any question and generate comprehensive executive summaries using Tiny AI Summarizer technology. The script checks if the necessary files are present, starts the web interface, and runs the enhanced universal app. It also handles keyboard interrupts and exceptions.\",\"/sales-sync-backend/reports_api.py\":\"This file is a Flask application that provides an API for managing and downloading reports. It does not contain any classes, but it has the following functions:\\n\\n`get_latest_file`: Retrieves the latest file of a given report type from the reports directory.\\n`get_all_files`: Retrieves all files of a given report type from the reports directory, sorted by modification time in descending order.\\n`list_latest_reports`: Provides an API endpoint to list the latest reports available.\\n`list_all_reports`: Provides an API endpoint to list all reports available.\\n`download_report`: Provides an API endpoint to download a specific report file.\\nThe application uses the Flask framework and the Flask-CORS extension to handle cross-origin resource sharing. It also utilizes the `os`, `glob`, and `datetime` modules to manage the file system and report types.\",\"/salespace-scan/src/hooks/use-mobile.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following function:\\n\\n`useIsMobile`: This function is a React hook that checks if the current device is a mobile device based on the screen width and provides a boolean value indicating whether the device is mobile or not.\\n\\nThe file also defines a constant `MOBILE_BREAKPOINT` which is set to 768, representing the screen width threshold for determining if a device is mobile or not.\",\"/Daily_salessync/Scripts/test_universal_ai.py\":\"This file is a Python script that tests the functionality of a Universal AI Assistant without a database connection. It does not contain any classes, but it has the following functions:\\n\\n`test_universal_ai()`: This function tests the Universal AI Assistant by creating a mock system, asking various questions, and verifying the responses.\\n\\nThe file serves as a test suite for the Universal AI Assistant, allowing developers to ensure that the system can answer a wide range of questions without relying on a database connection.\",\"/Daily_salessync/Scripts/web_interface/enhanced_universal_app.py\":\"This file is a Flask web application that provides an enhanced universal question-answering system with a Tiny AI-powered summarizer. It allows users to chat with the AI assistant, generate executive summaries, and get information about the system\\u0027s capabilities and features.\\n\\n`EnhancedUniversalQASystem`: This class represents the enhanced universal question-answering system that powers the web application.\\n\\n`initialize_qa_system()`: This function initializes the enhanced universal Q\\u0026A system.\\n\\n`index()`: This function renders the main page of the web application.\\n\\n`chat()`: This function handles chat messages and returns responses from the enhanced universal Q\\u0026A system.\\n\\n`generate_executive_summary()`: This function generates a comprehensive executive summary.\\n\\n`status()`: This function checks the status of the enhanced universal AI system and returns information about its capabilities.\\n\\n`examples()`: This function returns a list of example questions that the system can handle.\\n\\n`model_info()`: This function returns information about the AI model used in the system.\",\"/Daily_salessync/Scripts/web_interface/universal_app.py\":\"This file is a Flask web application that provides a universal question-answering system using an AI-powered chatbot. It does not contain any classes, but it has the following functions:\\n\\n`initialize_qa_system()`: Initializes the universal Q\\u0026A system.\\n\\n`index()`: Renders the main page of the web application.\\n\\n`chat()`: Handles chat messages and returns responses from the universal Q\\u0026A system.\\n\\n`status()`: Checks the status of the universal Q\\u0026A system and returns information about its capabilities.\\n\\n`examples()`: Returns a list of example questions that the universal Q\\u0026A system can handle.\\n\\n`model_info()`: Returns information about the AI model used in the universal Q\\u0026A system.\\n\\nThe file also sets up the Flask application and starts the web server.\",\"/salespace-scan/src/pages/Login.tsx\":\"This file is a React component that implements a login form for a web application. It uses the `react-hook-form` library for form handling and the `zod` library for form validation. The component also integrates with an `AuthContext` to handle user authentication and redirects the user to the dashboard if they are already authenticated.\\n\\n`loginSchema`: A Zod schema that defines the validation rules for the login form.\\n\\n`Login`: A React functional component that renders the login form, handles form submission, and manages the authentication state.\\n\\n`onSubmit`: A function that is called when the login form is submitted, which attempts to log the user in using the provided credentials.\",\"/salespace-scan/src/components/ui/command.tsx\":\"This file defines a set of React components that create a command dialog interface using the Radix UI library and the `cmdk` library. Here are the class and function names with their summaries:\\n\\n`Command`: A custom React component that extends the `CommandPrimitive` component from the `cmdk` library and applies some default styles.\\n\\n`CommandDialog`: A custom React component that wraps the `Command` component in a `Dialog` component from the `@/components/ui/dialog` module.\\n\\n`CommandInput`: A custom React component that extends the `CommandPrimitive.Input` component and adds a search icon and some styling.\\n\\n`CommandList`: A custom React component that extends the `CommandPrimitive.List` component and applies a maximum height and overflow styles.\\n\\n`CommandEmpty`: A custom React component that extends the `CommandPrimitive.Empty` component and applies some default styles.\\n\\n`CommandGroup`: A custom React component that extends the `CommandPrimitive.Group` component and applies some default styles.\\n\\n`CommandSeparator`: A custom React component that extends the `CommandPrimitive.Separator` component and applies some default styles.\\n\\n`CommandItem`: A custom React component that extends the `CommandPrimitive.Item` component and applies some default styles.\\n\\n`CommandShortcut`: A custom React component that renders a span element with some default styles for displaying a shortcut.\",\"/salespace-scan/src/lib/imageCompress.ts\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following function:\\n\\n`compressImage`: This function takes a file, an optional maximum size in MB, and an optional maximum width or height, and compresses the image using the `browser-image-compression` library, with multiple fallback options to ensure the image is compressed to the desired size.\\n\\nThe file exports the `compressImage` function, which can be used to compress images in a web application.\",\"/salespace-scan/src/components/ui/skeleton.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following function:\\n\\n`Skeleton`: A React component that renders a skeleton loader with a rounded-corner and a pulsing animation, which can be used as a placeholder while content is being loaded.\"}"}
